titles.title: Agricultural Reconciliation Act of 1999

To prevent the implementation of parity payments and certain marketing quotas under the Agricultural Adjustment Act of 1938 and the Agricultural Act of 1949, to reduce the amounts available for payments under production flexibility contracts entered into under the Agricultural Market Transition Act, and to shorten the period during which such payments will be made.

bill.summary: 1/19/1999--Introduced. Agricultural Reconciliation Act of 1999 - Amends the Agricultural Act of 1938 to repeal provisions regarding: (1) parity payments to producers of wheat, corn, cotton, rice, or tobacco; (2) farm marketing quotas and acreage allotments for corn; (3) marketing quotas for wheat, cotton, and rice; and (4) wheat marketing allocation. Amends the Agricultural Act of 1949 to repeal certain price support provisions and price supports for cotton, feed grains, and wheat. Amends the Agricultural Market Transition Act to reduce payment amounts available for production flexibility contracts. Prohibits price supports beginning with FY 2002.
